Teaching

Courses taught (or developed)

  • MATH 1113 Mathematics for General Education
  • MATH 2153 Bio-Calculus This class uses custom materials that have substantially devolved from the inspiring textbook Modeling the Dynamics of Life by Fred Adler, developed jointly with Brittany Bannish.
  • MATH 2313 Calculus I
  • MATH 2753 Technology for Professional Mathematics and Statistics This class uses custom materials that have been developed to introduce software for mathematical typesetting, introductory numerical computing, and introductory symbolic manipulation.
  • MATH 3103 Differential Equations
  • MATH 49/5910 Introduction to Biological Dynamics
  • MATH 4263/5373 Applied Numerical Analysis This class limps along using the oldest possible edition of the great book Numerical Analysis by Burden and Faires. I try to spice it up by doing interesting things with the order of topics and bringing in more modern, but still accessible, research papers and reviews.
  • MATH 49/5910 Industrial Applications
  • STAT 4113 Mathematical Statistics I - I get to teach a class using my own copy of Freundâ€™s Mathematical Statistics (from when I took the class myself)!
